messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The Capitol is the government. The Capitol uses the games to punish the districts. They punish them because they fought against the Capitol in the past. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each district. The children are between 12 and 18 years old. They have to fight in a big game and only one person can live. The chosen teenagers are called "tributes". Tributes are the people who are chosen to fight. All the people in the country have to watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text violates core rules. 1. Vocabulary: The word 'district' is B1 level and was not simplified. This is a direct violation of the A2 vocabulary rule. 2. Factual Accuracy: The original text states the children are chosen 'by lottery'. Your output omits this information, which is a factual inaccuracy. 3. Sentence Structure: The repeated use of the passive voice ('are called', 'are chosen') increases the grammatical complexity beyond the A2 standard.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The Capitol is the government. It controls different areas of the country. In the past, these areas fought against the Capitol. So the Capitol uses the games to show it is still in control. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. They choose them in a lottery. This means the choice is by chance. The children are between 12 and 18 years old. They have to fight in a big game, and only one person can live. They call these teenagers 'tributes'. Tributes are the people who fight in the games. All the people in the country have to watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: The text fails due to a vocabulary violation. The word 'teenagers' is B1 level. An A2 text must not use it. Replace it with 'young people' or 'the children'. While the simplification of complex concepts like 'rebellion' and the explanation of 'lottery' are well-executed, the rules are absolute. The sentence structure is appropriately simple for the A2 level, which is commendable. However, a single vocabulary error results in failure.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The Capitol is the government. It controls different areas of the country. In the past, these areas fought against the Capitol. So the Capitol uses the games to show it is still in control. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. They choose them in a lottery. This means the choice is by chance. The children are between 12 and 18 years old. They have to fight in a big game. Only one person can live. They call these young people 'tributes'. Tributes are the people who fight in the games. All the people in the country have to watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text fails on factual accuracy. The original text states the games are used to 'remind the districts that they are being punished'. Your output changes this reason to 'show it is still in control'. This is an interpretation, not a simplification. The concept of 'punishment' is completely omitted, which is a significant factual deviation. While the vocabulary and sentence structure are otherwise excellent for the A2 level, this error is critical and results in failure.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The Capitol is the government. It controls different areas of the country. In the past, these areas fought against the Capitol. So the Capitol uses the games to remind them this was wrong. The games make the people in the areas suffer. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. They choose them in a lottery. This means the choice is by chance. The children are between 12 and 18 years old. They have to fight in a big game. Only one person can live. They call these young people 'tributes'. Tributes are the people who fight in the games. All the people in the country have to watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text is a strong attempt but violates the strict vocabulary rule. The word 'suffer' is B1 level. An A2 text cannot use this word. Instead of 'The games make the people in the areas suffer', use 'The games are very bad for the people in the areas' or 'The games make the people feel sad and afraid'. The rest of the text successfully simplifies complex ideas like 'punishment' and 'lottery' into A2 language and maintains factual accuracy with simple sentence structures. However, a single vocabulary violation results in failure.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The Capitol is the government. It controls different areas of the country. In the past, these areas fought against the Capitol. So the Capitol uses the games to show them this was wrong. The games make the people feel very sad and afraid. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. They choose them in a lottery. This means the choice is by chance. The children are between 12 and 18 years old. They have to fight in a big game. Only one person can live. They call these young people 'tributes'. Tributes are the people who fight in the games. All the people in the country have to watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text introduces new information not present in the original source, which is a critical error. The sentence 'The games make the people feel very sad and afraid' is a complete fabrication. The original text does not mention the emotional state of the people. Furthermore, the explanation 'The Capitol is the government. It controls different areas of the country' is an addition. Your task is to simplify the provided text, not to add background information. While the vocabulary simplification and sentence structure are appropriate for A2, the factual inaccuracies make the output a total failure.

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The Capitol uses the games to punish the different areas of the country. This is because the areas fought against the Capitol in the past. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. They are between 12 and 18 years old. They choose them in a lottery. This means the choice is by chance. They have to fight in a game. Only one person can live. They call these young people 'tributes'. Tributes are the people who fight in the games. All the people in the country have to watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS. The provided feedback is a perfect example of what is required. It is direct ('FAILED.'), identifies the specific issue ('uses the word 'punish''), explains the rule ('An A2 text must exclusively use A2 vocabulary'), and provides a constructive alternative.
